column5: I took a series of photos on the Sand River up near Wawa...When I got home I thought how wonderful it would be if I could get the photos painted into a large painting to go above my couch...it is a very long room.  Thanks Pam for using your creative Genious to work my photos into this...    and another view    lastly my christmas tree    Thanks again, Pam.  I look forward to receiving the print for my office.

That is a big wall.  It could have accomodated bigger.  I'm just glad you are happy with it.  I loved painting it!  Big, bold strokes.  A lot different than the smaller pieces I work on.  That is the way I'm heading, bigger is better in my book.  Merry Xmas pigeonfisher and family.    Pam

thanks, Pam.  We couldn't be happier.  Everyone who sees it is truly astonished by the beauty.  What I like is everytime you look at it you can find something else that makes it unique.  The use of bright colours in the rock and "dirt" is just WILD!!!!  Happy Holidays to you to Pam!!!   I will let my wife know that you liked the decorating job on the tree!  What do you think of the painting?
Great painting, really nice scene and well-executed. I'm really impressed with Pam's talent, having seen some of her other painting posts here...  Mike
wow....man she's good !!!!  the painting seem to flow through the walls! ciff...

I think you should have just invited her south for a few weeks and had her paint the hole wall Steve!  Looks great Pam...now quit practicing...when you gonna paint my bird?..that didn't sound right... LOL
I couldn't be more impressed with her work...hopefully another piece to add to the wall next year.
Hey, remember, I have to start that one over.  Pam
